>So said javainsel on 4/14/2003 --------------------
>1. How would you call=
 the test cases: xxxTest or TestXXX?

Personal preference. I choose xxxTest=
 or xxxTestCase.

>2. If there is a class which has to be tested and which =
throws 
>different exceptions: Would you create one test method per each 
>=
exception or one test method per each method which throws it?

Classes don'=
t throw exceptions; methods do.

For each scenario under which I expect an =
exception to be thrown, I would likely write a separate test.

>3. Would yo=
u use class variables to improve perforamance of the 
>tests? Or would you =
not do that because it can mess up the test or 
>make it difficult to read?=


How do class variables improve the performance of tests?

>4. Do you use =
the JUnit addons? How likely is it that we will need 
>them?

You don't nee=
d them, but it's good to know what Vladimir offers, in case you'd rather us=
e someone else's code over building your own.
